resources.string: Select the variant of this medication.
To search, enter at least 3 characters.
No medications found in database. Revise your search term or tap Cancel to enter a custom medication name.
Select one of the medication variants.
%1$s can not be deleted because one or more medications (%2$s) are using it.
Sorry, this device doesn\'t seem to have a contacts application.
The medication\'s end date must be after its start date (currently %1$s). Choose a later date.
Your Next dose of %1$s is scheduled to be taken more than one hour from now (%2$s). \n\nChange the settings to disable this alert.
These Medications are scheduled to be taken more than one hour from now (%2$s). \n\nChange the settings to disable this alert.
No dose log entries for %1$s for the past %2$d days.
My KP Meds Medication History Log
The My KP Meds medication history log for %1$s for the past %2$s is attached.
Please wait while we update your information
Server Error: An internal error has occurred on the My KP Meds server. Please try again in a few minutes, and if the issue persists, please contact us.
Are you sure you want to send? Your medication information will no longer be protected by the secure My KP Meds app.
The current list of medications tracked in My KP Meds is attached.

%1$s

These are the medications as entered into the My KP Meds App. This list may or may not match your medical record.
%1$s can not be deleted until that person\'s medications (%2$s) are assigned to someone else.
A network connection cannot be established. Please try again later.
Hide this medication from your medication list.
To remove these medications off your list,\n please contact your primary care physician

You have no medications in this list.

To archive a medication, go to the list or detail view of Medications.

Archived medications can be restored later if needed.
Your session has expired. Please start again.
A network connection cannot be established. Please try again later.
Help text describing what sort of item is being selected.
Archiving medications will remove medications from your list. You can restore it from navigation drawer.
Your medication history has been updated.
Keep it up! Taking medications as prescribed is key for your health
Are you sure you want to\nskip all your medications?
Are you sure you want to\nskip your medication?
You will see all your prescribed medications, including archived medications, when refilling. Select the medications you wish to refill.
Add medication back to active list.
This medication has been\nadded back to your Schedule\nand Medication list.
Permanently deleting medication and history.\nYou will not be able to undo.
You’re viewing %s of medication history.\nChange timeframe in settings.
Delete all My KP Meds information stored on this device
Are you sure you want to clear stored data?
View and manage a family members\nmedications
For questions about symptoms or medical advice
For questions about symptoms or medical advice
Experiencing a problem with My KP Meds?
My KP Meds requires at least one active member
Available M-Th: 8 am -7 pm, Fri 8 am - 5 pm.

For routine (maintenance) medications, members can phone, fax, or mail in their refill order using our EZ Refill line. Members can request mail delivery anywhere in the U.S. for no additional charge, or pick up their medicine at a Kaiser Permanente medical center pharmacy. Members will usually receive their delivery within 7 to 10 business days. Members can also call to find out when their refills are ready or talk to a pharmacists.
Members you have caregiver access for have been added. Manage their medications in Settings.
Members you have caregiver access for have been removed. Sign in to update reminders for you and your family.
Members you have caregiver access for have updated. Sign in to update reminders for you and your family.
We have updated your schedule and medication lists.
There have been multiple changes to My KP Meds. Sign in to see updates.
There has been a change to your Kaiser Permanente medications. Sign in to view updates.
There has been a change to your Kaiser Permanente medications. Sign in to view updates.
A member you have caregiver access for has made changes to their medications. Sign in to see updates.
Medication lists and scheduled reminders are up to date.
These medications have been discontinued or expired.
Interval reminders have been discontinued. Create a new reminder schedule
The app works best when this feature is enabled.
Turn on to receive reminders without signing in.
Your previously scheduled medication reminders will be updated.
Check internet connection or try again later.
You have reached your maximum dose limit for today.
Keep it up. Taking medications as prescribed is key for your health.
A network connection cannot be established. Please try again later
You need to be online to sign in.
User ID or Password is invalid, try again.
We\'re sorry, we\'re unable to connect to retrieve your data at this time. Please try again later.
You\'re also signed in on another device.
If you continue, any changes will not appear on previous device until you sign in to that device again.
If you continue, the previous user will stop getting alerts on this device.
Why do I need to sign in?
We ask you to sign in with your kp.org user ID and password to protect the privacy of your health information when using our app.
How do I get a user ID and password?
If you\'re a Kaiser Permanente member, you can register at kp.org for a new user ID and password.
We\'ve disabled your account for your protection. Please sign in to kp.org to reactivate it.
To continue using My KP Meds you must get the latest version from the Google Play Store.
Your session has expired. Please start again.
Please go to apps settings and change the permission
You will no longer receive reminders for this medication.
It\'s time to take your %1$s medications.
It\'s time to take your %1$s medication.
Your one time password activation is pending. Please go to kp.org to activate.
Our records indicate that you are no longer a Kaiser Permanente member. If you need help at this time, please visit kp.org or call Member Services at 1-800-464-4000
Enabling Biometrics sign-in to My KP Meds means all Biometrics setup on this device will be linked to your My KP Meds application.
If other people use Biometrics sign-in authentication on this device, they may be able to gain access to your account on My KP Meds and view information you consider to be private.
Touch fingerprint sensor to sign in to My KP Meds.
Biometrics Sign-In has been turned off.
Unable to verify Biometrics. You can setup this anytime in Settings.
Biometrics sign in is temporarily locked due to several failed attempts.
An error has occurred with the fingerprint sensor. If this message appears repeatedly, restart your device.
My KP Meds imports your Kaiser Permanente prescribed medications.
My KP Meds imports your Kaiser Permanente prescribed medications.
Order refills for Kaiser Permanente medications from your phone.
Some refills may require your doctor\'s \nauthorization.
Set up medication reminders, view medication history and order refills for family members.
To add a family member or grant caregiver access visit kp.org
Create daily, weekly and monthly reminder schedules to take your medications.
Save a step? Allow name, medication and dosage to display without signing in.
Order all of my hypertension medications & pick up testing strips.Ask my doctor to approve pain medication prescription.
If you have questions about this update, contact your doctor.
Create a reminder to refill Kaiser Permanente prescriptions.
Remind me when it\'s time to take\nmedications.
Add medications not on your Kaiser\nPermanente list.
Select a reminder time that occurs in the future.
Special characters and website links are not allowed in the text field.
What do you want to be reminded to refill?
It\’s time to refill your medication.
You will see all your prescribed and archived medications when refilling.
You will no longer receive reminder to refill this medication.
Our systems are not responding. Please try again later.
We are unable to perform the requested operation. Please try again later.
Please provide a valid email address.
These questions will be used to verify your identity when you call Kaiser Permanente.\n\n All fields are required. Don\'t use special characters.
Error(s) found. Review your answers and confirm the following.
Use at least 8 characters, 1 number or special characters.
At least 8 characters, 1 number or special characters.
Do we have your current address? If not, please update.
The image shown is an example only. Your medication may look different. If you have questions, ask your pharmacist.
My KP Meds is available to Kaiser Permanente members in the following areas:
We\'re unable to connect to retrieve your data at this time. Please try again later.
Your notifications could become disabled. Check your settings.
The newer Android operating systems include battery-saving settings that could disable My KP Meds notifications.
To prevent this, adjust your settings.
Tap Apps not optimized and select All.
Set toggle to Off for My KP Meds.
Tap Not optimized and select All apps.
Tap on My KP Meds, select Don\'t Optimize, and tap Done.
Make sure My KP Meds is not battery optimized.
Add medications to the new schedule.
Which medications are taken at the same time?
How often are these medications taken?
When do you want to be reminded?
How long is this schedule needed?
Which day(s) do you want to be reminded?
How often do you want to be reminded?
Switching between family members will discard any changes you’ve made.
Switching screen will discard any changes you’ve made.
You can’t create duplicate reminders for the same time.
There are updates to your medications or schedule. Sign in to view changes.
You\'ll be able to access the app features as soon as your Kaiser Permanente coverage starts. \n\n Go to kp.org to view your health plan benefits and more.
This schedule has ended, if you want to continue getting alerts, change the end date.
Archiving removes a medication from your medication display.
Receive notifications to take your medication.
Your dose has been added to history.
Turning on “Take as Needed” will remove any scheduled reminders for this medication.
Record doses that are taken \nwithout a regular schedule.
The medication isn\'t added to your medical record or shared with your doctor or pharmacist.
Update to Teen Medical Information Access
Due to federal and state privacy laws, parent or caregiver access to medical information for teen members is limited.
Reminders set for the last day of every month
What time do you want to be reminded?
When do you want to start a monthly reminder
App unavailable to members receiving care outside their home service area. To view or refill your prescriptions, visit kp.org.
The postponed time exceeds the next scheduled reminder.
Recent changes will not be saved.
We are unable to retrieve your data at this time. Please try again later.
When would you like to be reminded?
What time did you take it?
You don\'t have a Kaiser Permanente plan. Visit kp.org to view your medical record
Your detailed medication history will display here.
You don\'t have any scheduled reminders this week.
Set up a medication reminder schedule. Your weekly medication history will then display here.
This lets us check for medication and schedule updates.
Do you want to save your changes?
Does this schedule match the instructions?
